heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 08 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 9.9°C), outside temperature (down 9.0°C), and inside temperature (down 3.4°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 348 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 10.7°C), cloud levels (up 330 m), and inside temperature (up 4.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 347.5m lower than yesterday, 221.4m lower than the past week, 330.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 993m and a peak of 2630m, averaging 1275.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; subzero temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dark. High pressure suggests settled weather.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.4°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
